{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3345252,"name":"Shorya Malani","username":"shoryamalani","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/8c91f0/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-27T15:11:19.633Z","cooked":"

Hey guys, I know there are almost a dozen threads about swerves not driving straight, and I have read and tried almost all of them.

The problems:
without heading PID, we cannot drive straight (our heading changes, pretty aggressively, while driving), if we run dynamic acceleration based on actual swerve module speed, its significantly closer, but still not perfectly straight. The turning without heading pid and without dynamic acceleration is about 10 deg/s on average mostly concentrated at the start and the end but still changing throughout

we cannot do figure eights (Rotating while translating). Obviously, we don’t need this in match, but when we turn while driving, we shoot off 45 degrees in the wrong direction most of the time.

we often do not hit our turn set points. We are currently using Vex Grip Lock, which have been amazing, but it means that the swerve turn rarely gets the accuracy better than a few degrees off. We have started resorting to adding I terms to our turn modules to get them closer to the correct set points.

next, none of our modules seem consistent. There are days where I pull out a carpet, and we can just easily follow an auto, our robot drives reasonably (still with terrible rotation while translating), and the next day with the same constants and no build changes, it will act entirely differently. Sometimes I can tune it to make it hit set points well and within 15 minutes it no longer hits those set points.

Finally, randomly we have very significant lag, with no code changes, no noticeable wifi changes, and no packet loss, we will go from having no input delay to a quarter second of it. The rio is not overrunning loops at this point any more than when there is no lag, and the lag is not only on drivetrain but everything.

What have we tried/ what do logs say:
Logs:
luckily, logs show odometery clearly knowing where we are going and knowing we are skewing

sometimes, we seem to be wheeling, where two of our wheels will accelerate far faster than the actual robot and then slow down a fifth of a second later

Tuning:
we have tried tuning FF using 6328’s tuning method and got decent results for drive and wheel radius

for turn I have tried almost all combos of PD loops and ended up with 6.0,3.0,0.003 - I get this is really nonstandard, but even this doesn’t work while being the closest thing to working

we have tried cleaning the carpet out of our modules - and while it sometimes makes it better for a little while, it never really lasts that long and the modules don’t seem to have that much carpet in them

We have reset our zero’s with speed squares. and can get to positional set points in the air

we have tried positionControl and velocity control directly from CTRE

We have tried changing our wheel base size and track width

We have tried turning on and off our discretize method as well as our wheel saturation method

we have tried capping our max speed

Right after tuning, it often works for a very very brief bit (minutes), but then it becomes unusably bad again.

we have also tried running only on FF without any PID (which actually wasn’t terrible) - https://github.com/team422/frc-24/blob/ff5986af7786a5dce8934aa66e8140e83ed6a17c/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/drive/Drive.java#L274

Here’s our drive function - frc-24/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/drive/Drive.java at ff5986af7786a5dce8934aa66e8140e83ed6a17c · team422/frc-24 · GitHub

here’s our implementation of our drive set point - https://github.com/team422/frc-24/blob/ff5986af7786a5dce8934aa66e8140e83ed6a17c/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/drive/SwerveModuleIOKraken.java#L503
The commented out ones do work, but we were just testing all of the control options

and here’s our implementation of our turn set point -
https://github.com/team422/frc-24/blob/ff5986af7786a5dce8934aa66e8140e83ed6a17c/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/drive/SwerveModuleIOKraken.java#L536

Here’s our mechanical drive setup -
kraken x4 on drive
falcon x4 on turn
L3.5
SDS MK4i
Vex Griplock wheels

here is a link to our Scope logs
https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1YnQTF_G0xx49rk88BChBz-qSr1vDChyI?usp=sharing

What we plan to try next:
blank YAGSL project
CTRE swerve code generator
adding a fudge factor instead of using discretize method Kl* Omega and rotating our desired velocity using it
Try running this code on a Neo Neo set up (because thats what we have)

If you are still reading this. THANK YOU SO MUCH! If you have ideas, or have struggled with this yourself, please post something, I am really struggling out here and am hoping for any help I can get.

Google Drive","clicks":1},{"url":"https://github.com/team422/frc-24/blob/ff5986af7786a5dce8934aa66e8140e83ed6a17c/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/drive/SwerveModuleIOKraken.java#L503","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"frc-24/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/drive/SwerveModuleIOKraken.java at ff5986af7786a5dce8934aa66e8140e83ed6a17c · team422/frc-24 · GitHub","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64046,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/swerve-doesnt-drive-straight/460345/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3345295,"name":"joel truher","username":"truher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/truher/{size}/172222_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-27T15:41:29.223Z","cooked":"

in this sort of situation id recommend validating each control layer from the bottom up. trying to understand the whole stack at once involves too many variables, and it’s very easy to “fix” a problem in one level whose source is actually at a different level. your top level PID settings seem like that kind of fix.

for troubleshooting, team 100 have a “module state” driving mode, where the joystick input is applied as drive speed and steering position, the same for all four modules. that might be helpful.

another issue might be drive/steer torque coupling,

docs.google.com

Swerve Module Torque Coupling

This Doc is private

the paper suggests a feed forward solution but raising the steering positional feedback gain will also help a lot. we went from a P value of 1.5 rad/s per rad of error to 35, and I’ve heard of teams using 100, though I’m not sure the units there.

hope that helps!

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-03-27T15:41:29.223Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":246,"readers_count":245,"score":74.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":460345,"topic_slug":"swerve-doesnt-drive-straight","display_username":"joel truher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Zm6VpteqNMmT0VaTDhN5U6-jF3VS11uCoykzZUIGQdU/edit","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Swerve Module Torque Coupling - Google Docs","clicks":39}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53190,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/swerve-doesnt-drive-straight/460345/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3345894,"name":"Shorya Malani","username":"shoryamalani","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/8c91f0/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-28T01:21:28.776Z","cooked":"

I spent a while looking into this, and it’s definitely interesting. On the other hand, I am not sure it fits the bill for many of the issues I am seeing. For example, this assumes that the wheels can already get to a set point when on the ground and not moving, which we are still struggling with :(.

With that said, as soon as I get a robot I will definitely try this. Do you think there is something else we might be missing.

Thank you so much.

So when you say the robot is in the air and you can do positional set points, are you saying that the drive appears to work when the robot is up on blocks with no weight bearing?

Does the drive appear to hold the position as well? Meaning, if you help the joystick up in perpetuity, would they stay straight if the robot isn’t touching the ground?

Secondly, have you tried a set of wheels with less friction than the grip lock wheels?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-03-28T01:26:06.426Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":167,"readers_count":166,"score":38.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":460345,"topic_slug":"swerve-doesnt-drive-straight","display_username":"NewtonCrosby","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31346,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/swerve-doesnt-drive-straight/460345/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3345905,"name":"Josh (he/him)","username":"Josh_Fox","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/josh_fox/{size}/119506_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-28T01:27:48.502Z","cooked":"

Have you run through the Eight Steps in YAGSL’s documentation? I was really convinced we were driving fine the last couple weeks and were having tuning issues, but after working through them tonight and inverting our drive motors (we are on mk4s), it’s a night and day difference.

yes and yes
we’ve tipped the robot on its side to see the wheels and they all drive straight like they’re supposed to, we’ve also tried the standard billet wheels with black neoprene and experienced the same issues just with worse acceleration and deceleration performance

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-03-28T14:31:06.441Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":99,"readers_count":98,"score":24.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":460345,"topic_slug":"swerve-doesnt-drive-straight","display_username":"Matthew Tran","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":31346,"username":"NewtonCrosby","name":"NewtonCrosby","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/ed8c4c/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52447,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"422 Driver/CTO"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-doesnt-drive-straight/460345/7","custom_user_title":"422 Driver/CTO","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3346228,"name":"Matthew Tran","username":"mercified","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mercified/{size}/223189_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-28T14:31:49.419Z","cooked":"

for what it’s worth, our grip locks are worn down so much that they’re basically billet wheels

shoryamalani:

Here’s our mechanical drive setup -
kraken x4 on drive
falcon x4 on turn
L3.5
SDS MK4i
Vex Griplock wheels

It’s a big change, and not really compatible with AdvantageScope, but if you’re on all CTRE hardware I would highly recommend trying the CTRE Swerve Generator before anything else. YAGSL even recommends switching to it if all your hardware is compatible.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-03-28T15:14:22.642Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":92,"readers_count":91,"score":63.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":460345,"topic_slug":"swerve-doesnt-drive-straight","display_username":"Rahul Yarlagadda","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12760,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7457 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-doesnt-drive-straight/460345/9","custom_user_title":"7457 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3346335,"name":"Tetsuya Cox","username":"Tetsu","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/41988e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-28T16:09:23.071Z","cooked":"

Do you have

SwerveDriveKinematics.desaturateWheelSpeeds(swerveModuleStates, Constants.Swerve.maxSpeed);

in your code somewhere? This function stops the code from telling the modules to go faster then the modules are actually able to go.
